_header: Sure song in time past hath been doun a doun
Subjects: carols, political; occasional verse; Edward VI
_description: A ‘ballet’ sung at the Conduit in Cheap in honor of Edward VI, c. 1548 — six long quatrains (aabb) and burden: ‘Syng vp hart syng up hart an[d] syng no more do[w]ne / But joy in king edward þat wereth the crowne’

CollArmsAr17.First Lines:
Sur song in tyme past hath ben downe a downeAnd longe yt hath
                    lasted in towre and towne…
CollArmsAr17.Last Lines:
…but allway do your cure his pleasure to fulfyllThen shall yow
                    kepe right shure the honour of England styll
CollArmsAr17.Note:
Transcription from Greene (1935)
